00028 //#define USE_LINUX_SYSCALL
00029 
00030 #define RTAI_SYSCALL_NR      orig_eax
00031 #define RTAI_SYSCALL_ARGS    ecx
00032 #define RTAI_SYSCALL_RETPNT  edx
00033 
00034 #define LINUX_SYSCALL_NR      orig_eax
00035 #define LINUX_SYSCALL_REG1    ebx
00036 #define LINUX_SYSCALL_REG2    ecx
00037 #define LINUX_SYSCALL_REG3    edx
00038 #define LINUX_SYSCALL_REG4    esi
00039 #define LINUX_SYSCALL_REG5    edi
00040 #define LINUX_SYSCALL_REG6    ebp
00041 #define LINUX_SYSCALL_RETREG  eax
00042 
00043 #define SET_LXRT_RETVAL_IN_SYSCALL(retval) \
00044         do { \
00045                 if (r->RTAI_SYSCALL_RETPNT) { \
00046                         copy_to_user((void *)r->RTAI_SYSCALL_RETPNT, &retval, sizeof(retval)); \
00047                 } \
00048         } while (0)

00050 #define LOW  0
00051 #define HIGH 1

00075 union rtai_lxrt_t {
00076 
00077     RTIME rt;
00078     int i[2];
00079     void *v[2];
00080 };
00081 
00082 #ifdef __cplusplus
00083 extern "C" {
00084 #endif /* __cplusplus */
00085 
00086 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00087 
00088 #include <asm/segment.h>
00089 #include <asm/mmu_context.h>
00090 
00091 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,0)
00092 #define __LXRT_GET_DATASEG(reg) "movl $" STR(__KERNEL_DS) ",%" #reg "\n\t"
00093 #else /* KERNEL_VERSION >= 2.6.0 */
00094 #define __LXRT_GET_DATASEG(reg) "movl $" STR(__USER_DS) ",%" #reg "\n\t"
00095 #endif  /* KERNEL_VERSION < 2.6.0 */
00096 
00097 static inline void _lxrt_context_switch (struct task_struct *prev,
00098                                          struct task_struct *next,
00099                                          int cpuid)
00100 {
00101     struct mm_struct *oldmm = prev->active_mm;
00102 
00103 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2,6,0)
00104     switch_mm(oldmm,next->active_mm,next,cpuid);
00105 
00106     if (!next->mm)
00107         enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,next,cpuid);
00108 #else /* >= 2.6.0 */
00109     switch_mm(oldmm,next->active_mm,next);
00110 
00111     if (!next->mm) enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,next);
00112 #endif /* < 2.6.0 */
00113 
00114 /* NOTE: Do not use switch_to() directly: this is a compiler
00115    compatibility issue. */
00116 
00117 /* It might be so but, with 2.6.xx at least, only for the inlined case. 
00118    Compiler compatibility issues related to inlines can appear anywhere.
00119    This case seems to be solved by staticalising without inlining, see LXRT.
00120    So let's experiment a bit more, simple Linux reuse is better (Paolo) */
00121 
00122 #if 1
00123     switch_to(prev, next, prev);
00124 #else
00125     __asm__ __volatile__(                                               \
00126                  "pushfl\n\t"                                           \
00127                  "cli\n\t"                                              \
00128                  "pushl %%esi\n\t"                                      \
00129                  "pushl %%edi\n\t"                                      \
00130                  "pushl %%ebp\n\t"                                      \
00131                  "movl %%esp,%0\n\t"    /* save ESP */                  \
00132                  "movl %3,%%esp\n\t"    /* restore ESP */               \
00133                  "movl $1f,%1\n\t"      /* save EIP */                  \
00134                  "pushl %4\n\t"         /* restore EIP */               \
00135                  "jmp "SYMBOL_NAME_STR(__switch_to)"\n"                 \
00136                  "1:\t"                                                 \
00137                  "popl %%ebp\n\t"                                       \
00138                  "popl %%edi\n\t"                                       \
00139                  "popl %%esi\n\t"                                       \
00140                  "popfl\n\t"                                            \
00141                  :"=m" (prev->thread.esp),"=m" (prev->thread.eip),      \
00142                   "=b" (prev)                                           \
00143                  :"m" (next->thread.esp),"m" (next->thread.eip),        \
00144                   "a" (prev), "d" (next),                               \
00145                   "b" (prev));                                          
00146 #endif
00147     barrier();
00148 }
00149 
00150 #if 0
00151 #define IN_INTERCEPT_IRQ_ENABLE()   do { rtai_hw_sti(); } while (0)
00152 #define IN_INTERCEPT_IRQ_DISABLE()  do { rtai_hw_cli(); } while (0)
00153 #else
00154 #define IN_INTERCEPT_IRQ_ENABLE()   do { } while (0)
00155 #define IN_INTERCEPT_IRQ_DISABLE()  do { } while (0)
00156 #endif
00157 
00158 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00159 
00160 /* NOTE: Keep the following routines unfold: this is a compiler
00161    compatibility issue. */
00162 
00163 static union rtai_lxrt_t _rtai_lxrt(int srq, void *arg)
00164 {
00165         union rtai_lxrt_t retval;
00166 #ifdef USE_LINUX_SYSCALL
00167         RTAI_DO_TRAP(SYSCALL_VECTOR, retval, srq, arg);
00168 #else
00169         RTAI_DO_TRAP(RTAI_SYS_VECTOR, retval, srq, arg);
00170 #endif
00171         return retval;
00172 }
00173 
00174 static inline union rtai_lxrt_t rtai_lxrt(short int dynx, short int lsize, int srq, void *arg)
00175 {
00176         return _rtai_lxrt(ENCODE_LXRT_REQ(dynx, srq, lsize), arg);
00177 }
00178 
00179 #define rtai_iopl()  do { extern int iopl(int); iopl(3); } while (0)
00180 
00181 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00182 
00183 #ifdef __cplusplus
00184 }
00185 #endif /* __cplusplus */

00187 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_I386_LXRT_H */
